revised_title: Nonlinear Stability of Hagen-Poiseuille Flow Through a Circular Pipe
tldr: This article investigates the nonlinear stability of Hagen-Poiseuille flow through a circular pipe, focusing on large Reynolds numbers and three-dimensional disturbances. The authors find that a crucial disturbance size exists, which alters the stability properties of the flow field significantly. They analyze the critical layer and wall layers, discovering neutral modes that exist within a specific range of parameters. The findings provide insight into the complex behavior of fluid flow in pipes and contribute to the understanding of fluid dynamics and hydrodynamics.
